<Link id="l00500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="500"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="501"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For G&#95;UITOFP and G&#95;FPTOUI without AVX512, we have to custom legalize types</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="502"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &lt;= s32 manually. Otherwise, in custom handler there is no way to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="503"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// understand whether s32 is an original type and we need to promote it to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="504"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// s64 or s32 is obtained after widening and we shouldn&#39;t widen it to s64.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="505"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="506"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For AVX512 we simply widen types as there is direct mapping from opcodes</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
